title: Ticket #4483: Remove GSI libraries from the shadow
description:
The GSI libraries add about 100kB of memory to every process that links to them. If any GSI functions are called, even more memory is used. This presents a scalability problem for the condor_shadow, which almost never needs to use GSI.

To remove GSI memory overhead from the shadow on linux, we plan to do the following:

  • Don't link the condor_utils library against the GSI and VOMS libraries. Instead, dlopen() those libraries whenever they're needed.
  • When the shadow needs to do something with the job's proxy certificate, have it fork a child process, which does the work and reports the results.

With these changes and setting SEC_ENABLE_MATCH_PASSWORD_AUTHENTICATION=True, the shadow will never have the GSI libraries loaded and can avoid the associated memory overhead.

However, hard-coding these will not (always) work in proper builds, so we don't use dlopen for proper builds. Now Jaime should review my changes.
